wikipedia_page.main: Robert Arthur Weale (born in Hereford on 3 April 1963), is a Welsh international lawn and indoor bowls player. Weale is originally from Presteigne and was educated at John Beddoes School, but now lives in Hereford, Herefordshire.

response: Lawn Bowler Robert Weale has represented Wales in 8 Commonwealth Games, 1986–2014, winning 2 gold, 3 silver and 1 bronze.
* Bowls player and Commonwealth Games gold-medallist, Robert Weale was raised and educated in the town

link_mentions.page: Lawn bowls at the 2010 Commonwealth Games – Men's singles
Lawn bowls at the 2014 Commonwealth Games – Men's pairs

response: Billy Jackson won the Men's singles defeating Robert Weale in the final.
In the singles Robert Weale won the title beating John Price in the final.
He was a pairs Commonwealth Games silver medallist at the 1994 Commonwealth Games with Robert Weale. He also represented Wales at the 1990 Commonwealth Games.
